description.narrative: IFC''s SME credit line would further help the Bank to extend longer term loans to the SMEs and therefore provide sustainable financing to expand their businesses. As the primary beneficiaries of the proposed senior loan would be SMEs, who is lacking access to especially long term finance from banks, the proposed loan is also expected to have positive impacts in terms of job creation and preservation because SMEs are the major source of employment in Turkey. Lastly, IFC''s partnering with Odeabank, a south-south investment, would have an important demonstration impact in terms of motivating other strong sponsors in the region to enter into the Turkish market

Odea Bank A.S. (Odea Bank or the Bank) is a newly formed green-field bank in Turkey that obtained its banking license on October 2, 2012. Odea Bank commenced its operations with US$300 million as paid in equity from its parent, Bank Audi- Saradar Group. Odea Banks business model and strategy is covering all business segments as a universal bank. IFCs proposed investment aims to increase access to finance for small and medium enterprises (SMEs) in Turkey through providing a senior loan to Odea Bank that targets SMEs.
